topics.name: Web Development for Beginners
topics.description: Articles aimed at beginners, such as IDE setup, creating your first web page, common beginner mistakes, etc.

topics.name: HTML
topics.description: HyperText Markup Language (HTML) is the foundation of all webpages. It acts as a skeleton, creating content and semantics.

topics.name: CSS
topics.description: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is the styling language of the web. Its responsibilities is layout and styling.

topics.name: JavaScript
topics.description: JavaScript (JS) is the programming language of the web. It is one of the world's most popular programming languages.

topics.name: React
topics.description: React is the most widely used JavaScript framework. It allows for dynamic content and reusable components.

topics.name: NodeJS
topics.description: NodeJS is a server-side JavaScript runtime. It allows developers to use JavaScript for backend applications.

topics.name: TailwindCSS
topics.description: TailwindCSS is a utility CSS framework. It allows you to style elements with classnames. It also doubles as a design system.

topics.name: MongoDB
topics.description: MongoDB is a NoSQL document database. It uses BSON (Binary JSON) to store large amounts of data effectively.

topics.name: TypeScript
topics.description: TypeScript is a JavaScript superset that adds static types to JavaScript. It also makes it possible to use new JavaScript features on old runtimes.
